images.caption: Scots Pine – colorized drawing by Josef Dohnal
Scots Pine – young cones are green, turn dark brown when ripe
Scots Pine – male inflorescences are yellow, grow at the base of new branches
Scots Pine – female inflorescences are red-violet – grow at the ends of the branches
Scots Pine – the bark is grey-brown-rusty, getting rusty-pink towards the top of the plant
Scots Pine – pollen grain (photo from the light microscope); photo by Petr Pokorný
